title: Mean and Standard Deviation
question_text:
On a recent statistics exam at a large university, a random sample of $50$ students was taken from one section. Among them, $35$ passed the exam.
What is the mean and standard deviation of the sampling distribution of the sample proportion of students who passed the exam?
solution:
The mean of the proportion is $\dfrac{35}{50} = 70\%$.

The standard deviation of the proportion $6.48\%$, using the formula below, substituting $p = 0.7$ and $n = 50$:

$$\sigma = \sqrt{\dfrac{p(1-p)}{n}}$$

$$\sigma = \sqrt{\dfrac{0.7(1-0.7)}{50}}$$

$$\sigma =6.48$$

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'C'.
